GSD.description: Octopoller is a micro gem for polling and retrying. Version 0.2.0 of the octopoller gem was published containing world-writeable files. Specifically, the gem was packed with files having their permissions set to `-rw-rw-rw-` (i.e. 0666) instead of `rw-r--r--` (i.e. 0644). This means everyone who is not the owner (Group and Public) with access to the instance where this release had been installed could modify the world-writable files from this gem. This issue is patched in Octopoller 0.3.0. Two workarounds are available. Users can use the previous version of the gem, v0.1.0. Alternatively, users can modify the file permissions manually until they are able to upgrade to the latest version.

osvSchema.summary: Octopoller gem published with world-writable files
osvSchema.details:
### Impact

Version [0.2.0](https://rubygems.org/gems/octopoller/versions/0.2.0)
of the octopoller gem was published containing world-writeable files. Specifically,
the gem was packed with files having their permissions set to `-rw-rw-rw-` (i.e.
0666) instead of `rw-r--r--` (i.e. 0644).

This means everyone who is not the owner (Group and Public) with access to the
instance where this release had been installed could modify the world-writable
files from this gem.

Malicious code already present and running on your machine, separate from this
package, could modify the gemâ€™s files and change its behavior during runtime.

### Patches
* octopoller v0.3.0

### Workarounds
Users can use the previous version of the gem [v0.1.0](https://rubygems.org/gems/octopoller/versions/0.1.0).
Alternatively, users can modify the file permissions manually until they are able
to upgrade to the latest version.
